title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right
snippets: The far-right figurehead has been barred from running for public office for five years, throwing her plans into disarray.
summary: A far-right political figure has been banned from seeking any public office for a period of five years, disrupting her future political ambitions.

title: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake
snippets: Myanmar's military government says at least 2,000 people were killed in last week's 7.7 magnitude quake.
summary: Myanmar's military government reported that a 7.7 magnitude earthquake last week resulted in at least 2,000 fatalities.

title: US deports more alleged gang members to El Salvador
snippets: Officials said 17 alleged criminals were deported despite a court order.
summary: Seventeen individuals, described as alleged criminals, were deported in violation of a court order, according to officials.

title: Russia still 'working with US' after Trump says he is 'angry' with Putin
snippets: In its first response to Trump's criticism of Putin, the Kremlin tried to play down the tensions between the two leaders.
summary: The Kremlin has attempted to minimize the significance of tensions between Trump and Putin following Trump's criticism of Putin. This marks the first time the Kremlin has responded to such criticisms.

title: Zimbabwe shuts down amid calls for protests
snippets: Many streets across Zimbabwe remained deserted and empty on the day of a planned protest.
summary: Streets in various parts of Zimbabwe were largely deserted on the day a protest was scheduled to occur.

title: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game
snippets: Everything you need to know about the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game on Tuesday (6:30 p.m. ET, ESPN2).
summary: The 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game is scheduled for Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. ET and will be broadcast on ESPN2.

title: What will Titans, Browns do with top 2 draft picks? From QBs to generational players, breaking down 5 biggest questions
snippets: Would Tennessee consider trading down? Does Cleveland actually want to trade *up*? Is anyone besides a QB in play at the top of the draft? Here's what Monday's interview sessions at the spring owners meetings tell us.
summary: At the spring owners meetings, discussions during Monday's interview sessions revealed considerations around draft strategies, including whether Tennessee might trade down and if Cleveland is looking to trade up. The possibility of selecting players other than quarterbacks at the top of the draft was also discussed.

title: Braves' Profar gets 80-game ban for PED violation
snippets: Atlanta Braves outfielder Jurickson Profar was suspended for 80 games by Major League Baseball on Monday after a positive test for the performance-enhancing drug chorionic gonadotropin.
summary: Atlanta Braves outfielder Jurickson Profar has been suspended for 80 games by Major League Baseball due to a positive test for the performance-enhancing drug chorionic gonadotropin.

title: Browns' Haslam: 'Big swing-and-miss' on Watson
snippets: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam said the team "took a big swing-and-miss" in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a $230 million deal that was fully guaranteed.
summary: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam admitted the team made a significant error in acquiring quarterback Deshaun Watson and signing him to a fully guaranteed $230 million deal, describing it as a "big swing-and-miss."

title: Harper, projected No. 2 pick, declares for draft
snippets: Rutgers freshman Dylan Harper, the projected No. 2 pick in the 2025 NBA draft, announced on ESPN's "NBA Today" on Monday that he will declare for the draft.
summary: Dylan Harper, a freshman at Rutgers and expected to be the second pick in the 2025 NBA draft, announced on ESPN's "NBA Today" that he will enter the draft.

title: US stocks post worst quarter since 2022 as tariff worries swirl
snippets: S&P 500 sinks almost 5% in first three months of 2025 on rising concerns over economy
summary: The S&P 500 fell nearly 5% in the first quarter of 2025 due to growing worries about the economy.

title: Trump has promised tariff ‘liberation day’. Americans aren’t so sure
snippets: Even the president’s supporters are sceptical of new levies to be imposed on trading partners on April 2
summary: Supporters of the president express skepticism regarding new trade levies set to be imposed on trading partners starting April 2.

title: Is UBS’s ‘deal of the century’ starting to sour?
snippets: The bank’s integration of Credit Suisse is going well. It’s everything else that’s the problem
summary: The bank reports that its integration of Credit Suisse is progressing successfully. However, it is facing challenges in other areas of its operations.

title: Lessons from Russia, Turkey and India for Trump’s America
snippets: Fighting for democracy can be a lonely and dangerous business
summary: Advocating for democracy often involves significant risks and can lead to isolation for those involved in the struggle.

title: America cannot afford to break global investor trust
snippets: Even the most powerful nation in the world needs foreign investment
summary: The United States, recognized as the world's most powerful nation, requires foreign investment to support its economy.

title: Martian dust could pose health risks to future astronauts
snippets: Inhaling dust particles from the Red Planet over long periods of time could put humans at risk of developing respiratory issues, thyroid disease and other health problems.
summary: Prolonged inhalation of dust particles from Mars may pose health risks to humans, including respiratory problems and thyroid disease.

title: Efficient light control: Meta-optics replace conventional lenses
snippets: Be it sensors, cameras, or displays: Metasurfaces have the potential to fundamentally improve optical systems in our everyday lives. By controlling light more precisely, they drive compact, multi-functional solutions. Researchers have now developed an optical component that enables highly efficient light control at steep angles of incidence, overcoming previous limitations.
summary: Researchers have developed an optical component using metasurfaces, enhancing the ability to control light efficiently at steep angles. This advancement could significantly improve optical systems in everyday devices like sensors, cameras, and displays by making them more compact and multi-functional.

title: Preventable cardiac deaths during marathons are down
snippets: New findings indicate that while the rate of marathon runners who suffer cardiac arrests remained unchanged, their chance for survival is twice what it was in the past. Now, far fewer marathon runners who suffer cardiac arrest are dying of it.
summary: Recent research shows that although the occurrence of cardiac arrests among marathon runners has not decreased, their survival rate has doubled. Consequently, fewer marathon runners experiencing cardiac arrests are now dying from them.

title: Cave spiders use their webs in a way that hasn't been seen before
snippets: Cave-dwelling orb spiders have adapted their webs so they act as tripwires for prey that crawl on the walls of the caves
summary: Cave-dwelling orb spiders have evolved their web designs to function as tripwires, effectively capturing prey that moves along cave walls.

title: A revolutionary new understanding of autism in girls
snippets: By studying the brains of autistic girls, we now know the condition presents differently in them than in boys, suggesting that huge numbers of women have gone undiagnosed
summary: Recent research on the brains of autistic girls reveals that autism manifests differently in females compared to males. This discovery indicates that a significant number of women may have been undiagnosed with the condition.
